lines: I'm sorry you do not possess the money necessary to go through college. You can try again later.
I'm sorry, but you will have to enroll in a college first.
There are none of these experiences you can do right now.
Congratulations! You have graduated from college.
What kind of college would you like to attend?
You have met the qualifications for this school.
You are now enrolled. Your resources will decrease by $200 every time you access the college icon. This will cover tuition and college-related costs. You will need 12 college experiences to graduate.
The entrance requirements for this school are too stringent to allow you admission at the present time. I am sorry.
You can choose from the following majors:
To tell you the truth, there aren't a great many job openings for Liberal Artists these days, but you will be receiving a very well-rounded educational experience. Good luck!
This is a demanding course of study. Your intellectual sphere had better be pretty sharp.

You are obviously interested in people, attitudes and the study of life as an experience. If you don't become soured by cynicism, you may gain great insight into yourself and others. Unless you intend to teach or go to graduate school,
you may have difficulty finding a job with the same rewards that your course of study provides.

You are almost guaranteed a job when you get out of school, but you may become rigid and materialistic. Let yourself be free to explore social and interpersonal relationships while you are pursuing this course of study.

You may have a need to see things as orderly and precise. This can lead you to avoid the messy worlds of values, social and interpersonal relationships and aesthetics. Be careful that you don't self-automate. Look what happened to me!
